channel.title: math.AC updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.AC updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Abelian extensions of equicharacteristic regular rings need not be Cohen-Macaulay
item.description: arXiv:2511.19800v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: By a theorem of Roberts, the integral closure of a regular local ring in a finite abelian extension of its fraction field is Cohen-Macaulay, provided that the degree of the extension is coprime to the characteristic of the residue field. We show that the result need not hold in the absence of this requirement on the characteristic: for each positive prime integer $p$, we construct polynomial rings over fields of characteristic $p$, whose integral closure in an elementary abelian extension of order $p^2$ is not Cohen-Macaulay. Localizing at the homogeneous maximal ideal preserves the essential features of the construction.
item.dc:creator: Aryaman Maithani, Anurag K. Singh, Prashanth Sridhar

item.title: On codimension-two subcanonical varieties inside $\mathbb{P}^n$
item.description: arXiv:2511.19962v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Let $X \subseteq \mathbb{P}^n, n \geq 3$ be a codimension-two subcanonical local complete intersection variety with ideal sheaf $\mathcal{I}_X$. Let $a_X \in \mathbb{Z}$ be such that $\omega_X = \mathscr{O}_X(a_X)$. Assume that there exists $\displaystyle j \leq \frac{a_X+n+2}{2}$ such that $\Gamma(\mathcal{I}_X(j)) \neq 0$. We prove some sufficient conditions on the first deficiency module $\mathrm{H}^1_*(\mathcal{I}_X)$ that ensures that $X$ is a complete intersection. We also show that smooth codimension-two $3$-Buchsbaum varieties inside $\mathbb{P}^n, n \geq 6$ are complete intersections.
item.dc:creator: Manoj Kummini, Abhiram Subramanian

item.title: The Alexander-Hirschowitz theorem for neurovarieties
item.description: arXiv:2511.19703v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We study neurovarieties for polynomial neural networks and fully characterize when they attain the expected dimension in the single-output case. As consequences, we establish non-defectiveness and global identifiability for multi-output architectures.
item.dc:creator: A. Massarenti, M. Mella

item.title: Dimension Polynomials for Affine Partial Difference Algebraic Groups
item.description: arXiv:2511.20350v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We develop the theory of difference algebraic groups in the case where we have finitely many pairwise commuting difference operators. We show that the defining ideal of a difference algebraic group is finitely generated as a difference ideal, and this result allows us to prove the existence of a dimension polynomial for any partial difference algebraic group.
item.dc:creator: Orla McGrath
